Reviews.Title: “Not for the faint hearted!!”
Reviews.Author: Mrs_Ramjam
Reviews.Content: I stayed here at short notice when I won tickets to a gig but did not want to fork out loads of money to stay in zone 1. I think we paid about £35 for the night so I knew the hotel was going to be basic and wasn't expecting a lot. I was right not to expect much because the place is pretty grim and I didn't sleep a wink all night! The foyer is horrible, the stairs and hallways are horrible and the rooms are shabby but ok if you are not at all fussy or squeamish about dirt and mould. Oh and the window didn't shut either. I wasn't necessarily disappointed - I think I just over estimated my ability to deal with the grime factor. Think Eddie and Richie's bedsit in the series 'Bottom' !! We skipped breakfast as I was too scared to even think about it! One thing though - as our gig at the Hammersmith Apollo finished late we would have had to get a black cab home to any of the other hotels we were thinking about staying at but as this was just down the road we strolled home which was one big plus and saved us ALOT of money! It is gross - but if you can deal with it it's a cheap way to stay in London - just make sure you have a few to drink before you go back to your room!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly adequate for the price”
Reviews.Author: Caomhinstravels
Reviews.Content: Clean room, decent bathroom, good shower, wifi in lobby, ok breakfast. For 30 quid a night this is good value overall. 3 min walk to the tube. Was worried after reading the reviews but I was pleasantly surprised to be honest. In London for a conference so the location was perfect for the tube. The staff were very friendly. I will definitely be back. If your looking for a place to sleep in London this place is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Okay, for the price”
Reviews.Author: Paul W
Reviews.Content: I wasn't expecting the Earth for the price I paid. The hotel is somewhere to sleep and, for the price that I paid, I can't really complain about the hotel or the service. The rooms are quite shabby, with holes in walls, loose shelves in the bathroom etc. It is clean, and functional, and the staff are friendly and helpful, but if you are looking for something more than just somewhere to sleep, there are better hotels for just a little more. I was a bit wary when my credit card details where copied onto an authorisation form which was then faxed somewhere else to be processed, however I had no issues. Car parking was available, for a charge, however there is on street parking which is free at weekends. Overall, you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “everthing fine”
Reviews.Author: Andcob
Reviews.Content: Stayed there on News Years Eve a bargain for £60 for a twin plus breakfast.Room was clean and quite modern in décor,plenty of hot water for a shower in the morning.Staff were friendly,when asked for photo I.D. explained I did not carry any that was fine.Excellence location for Hammersmith Apollo,minutes away.Overall value for money in a good location..

Reviews.Title: “worst hotel ever, absoloutly filthy it should be closed down”
Reviews.Author: lee r
Reviews.Content: dont bother even calling to see if they have availability, this has ben the worst hotel i have ever slept in, in 15 years of been a tradesman working away from home. initialy booked 2 nights via visa,it was late at night and we were struggling to find a room. on entering the building the laminate floor was filthy, we gave them the benefit of doubt and went to the room!! Tv didnt work, neither did the toilet flush, the boxing on the toilet was held together with parsel tape and the wood was disintagrating with what i guess was urine. carpet was full of cig burns and dirty. went to complain to the receptionist, he started to talk asian to his "friend" then they both started to laugh as us, and said the tv will be fixed in 2 weeks!! we was staying 2 nights.. 10 matress`s outside of the window in the garden with grass growing on them.carpet trimmings been thrown out of the windows and on the roof top below. in the morning i woke to a small red bug trying to get in my ear, we tried to get our money back and check out, he wouldnt return the money and walked off. i had to make a claim through visa for my money back after photos/videos were sent to them. and booked into premier inn just down the road Breakfast? Forget it!! we ran for the door with our bags.. please do your self a favour dont spend a night here, you really will regret it..

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting”
Reviews.Author: ashjay89
Reviews.Content: When we arrived the gentleman photocopied my fiance's drivig lisence and noted his card details down, we had room 216 and it is the most disgusting room we have ever stayed in. The floors were disgusting. The skirting was manky, the room was no bigger than tthe double bed, our window had a huge crack on it and didnt lock! Did not stay for breakfast, checked out at 7.30 the next morning

Reviews.Title: “no problems at all.”
Reviews.Author: pigofhappiness
Reviews.Content: Friend and I stayed over whilst going to the Hammersmith Apollo, we stayed 2 nights in total.Yep, it may look a little old and tired in places, but we couldnt complain for what we paid for the 2 nights and at the end of the day it was only used as a base. Lots to do and see just 2 mins away from it. We found the staff to be friendly, our room was clean, only downside was lack of pillows, but they were more than happy to provide us with more. Continental breakfast was ample, tea toast, cereal, fruit. Would definitely stay again . Lets face it, if you want 5*+ then you need to be paying prices in relation to it. Not bad at all this place.

Reviews.Title: “Nice cheap hotel well located.”
Reviews.Author: craigb1990
Reviews.Content: Really nice place, service was really good when me and my partner arrived we got put into a room whilst the paint was drying in the room we booked, when we arrived our bags were already in our new room, we were in the room for a few hours when the bed broke which didn't bother us too much as when we told the guy he said he would take a look in the morning which was not an issue, the down stairs front rooms are noisy as there is a main road out front, but its not to bad, when speaking to the guy in the morning he said if we pack our stuff he would move us to a new room and he did explain why the bed broke ( basically a honeymoon couple were a little rough with it lol) when we got back the hotel room 115 it was an even nicer room than the one before so it was great nice shower and toilet tv didn't work properly but we only used the place to sleep in so wasn't too bad, there is a £10 charge for parking but the guy said cause we've had a.few issue he would sort us out but it was cool when we were leaving we was able to leave our bags out back of reception which was really handy. The guy did explain he's having a lot of work done to the hotel to bring it back up to scratch, it was a really nice clean and friendly hotel we didn't eat there though.

Reviews.Title: “AVOID!!!”
Reviews.Author: max c
Reviews.Content: The place is tired beyond belief. The mattress may once have had some padding over the springs, but not any more. The disinfectant smell was overcome by the smell of charring wood from the broken bedside light burning the headboard. We left very early. It should be closed down.

Reviews.Title: “Stinking stig of a dump!!!”
Reviews.Author: emma l
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a stinking disgrace total waste of money!! we arrived and reception told us i had to leave my car keys with them as its policy and incase he needed to move my car, the stairways were smelly and black scuff marks all over the place toilet would not flush nails were sticking out the bath sockets hanging off the wall the wardrobe was like the leaning tower of pisa there was a big chunk out the floor curtains held up by 2 hooks beds were minging full of stains springs dug in out backs. totally needs closing down and doing up big time

Reviews.Title: “awful never going back”
Reviews.Author: gemma12Lancashire
Reviews.Content: never been to london before, we were going to a concert so booked this hotel. when we arrived we couldnt get in our room until we had stpped over 2 bin bags of smelling rubbish, and the whole carpet coverd in bit of crap. in the room our door had holes filled with polyfiller, by our pillows on the bed the lights switches were hanging out the wall very dangerous! there were nails sticking out the side of the bath, the curtains were hanging off fully, we had crusty stains on our top sheet and also had fag burns in it, there were no smoke alarms in the room, the wardrobe was tilting very badly so we didnt touch it the hairdryer in the room didnt work, neither did the shower, we had to wash our hair under the tap, and we had huge chunks missing out the floor. our bed actually has all the springs sticking out the top! the whole place was filthy. i realsie is you pay cheap money you dont get much, but surley general hygine is a must. how this place passes health and safety is beyond me!

Reviews.Title: “Watch your belongings!!”
Reviews.Author: clare c
Reviews.Content: I am never staying in this place again!! I left a bag in the luggage room, came back to get it and it was gone! All that was left there were my undies. Not impressed, I lost around 300pounds worth of clothes, etc. All the manager could say was sorry and he had no idea how this could happen. This place is a dump, I would not recommend it to anybody, the staff are so untrustworthy. So in the end I lost more money than what I saved staying in a sh**t hole!

Reviews.Title: “Definately not recommended!”
Reviews.Author: Joanne L
Reviews.Content: First impressions pretty much sum this hotel up - tatty, rundown, and smelly! The whole hotel is in dire need of a spruce up (or better still - a complete refurbishment!). The entrance hall is grotty and the "dining" area is foisty. The rooms are very small with a kettle that you have to boil on the floor and a television that you can't get a proper picture on. Our bathroom was mouldy with paint flaking off the walls and ceiling. The window to the room couldn't be shut as it had no handles and the bed was the most uncomfortable thing I have ever slept on - with the inner springs poking through to the top! We found buying a mattress topper was the only option to get any sleep on our second night! On a plus side, the staff were friendly enough, the sheets were clean and the hotel is just a stones throw away from both the Hammersmith Apollo and the tube station. However, I would not return and I would ceratinly not recommend this hotel to anyone that I liked.

Reviews.Title: “A hell hole...!!!”
Reviews.Author: pukindogs
Reviews.Content: A dump,a dive and a flea pit. Dirty towels ,no hot water in the showers. It is cheap for a reason. Only stay here if you cant find a hedge bottom. Truly awefull!!!

Reviews.Title: “Definitely one to avoid (like the plague)”
Reviews.Author: GastroGazza
Reviews.Content: The room was small and the heating was on throughout the hotel even though the external temperature was 29C when I arrived. There was no sink plug, but there was mould on the shower ceiling and the shower failed to empty properly. The wardrobe had a spare cover for the bed in it that looked like it had been stolen from a vagrant and it stank. Terrestrial television only. The breakfast was described as 'continental'. Not from any continent I know: few bits of mousetrap cheese in a bowl, white toast only, cheap tea (remove your own teabag) or Nescafe in a catering size value tin, surly person dishing up the toast behind the bar, Coco Pops and discount cornflakes. Absolutely dire. It doesn't matter if it is 'London' and that '£50 per night' is supposed to be 'cheap', these are people who don't care, who don't maintain their property, and just want your money. Nasty. Avoid it like the plague.

Reviews.Title: “SLUM!!!”
Reviews.Author: zoenjay02
Reviews.Content: Well were do i begin..... The hole place is a toilet, We needed a place to stay for the rugby but every were was booked up so found the premier west hotel and found it was cheap anuff and in a ideal location for were we needed to go. Read some reviews but thought it cant be that bad surley??? Well walk upto the building and it looks like a builders yard the stairs are all broken and a shabby looking building.. ok we go in the reception is disgusting the smell of old curry and mould is gross!!! The guy at the reception say have you got any I.D and take a photocopy of my husbands driving license weird... Then he says how are you going to pay my husband pull his card out and i wisper to my husband that i would rather pay cash which sound like we done the right thing cuming from some of the other reviews. We get given are key on the second floor room 214 we go up the stairs and the filth on the walls and carpet is disgusting theres a fire exstingusher hold a door open with a piece of string and the hole hotel stink. Find the key card hard to use and eventualy get into are room very small and standard with a t.v older than god with a indoor t.v ariel with no tv channels fittings fallen off or ripped off only a few lights worked there is a phone wat dont work the shower cieling was coverd in mould the underskirts of the bed were filthy. you get 1 flimsy pillow and a sheet for a cover, the noise from the traffic is terrible. I went into the down stairs ladies toilet and had to show my husband how bad it was half of the cieling had fallen down and the ceiling above the toilet was dipping and black and looked like it fall on your head at any time. Had breakfast the staff was rude and looked very unhappy being there all you get was a lousy piece of stale toast and a dirty looking bowl of cornflakes. All in all what a disgusting SLUM they call a hotel!!! H&S will have a field day there!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very much a case of you get what you pay for!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: cjsk1970
Reviews.Content: Having read the reviews after I'd booked this hotel, I was dreading checking in. The hotel is very rundown, but the room was adequate, linen and room reasonably clean, although the kettle didn't work. But they really really need to replace the beds....springs......and we didn't hang around for breakfast. If you're looking for nothing more than a cheap bed for the night, then it will serve its purpose. Would I stay here again, No!!!!

Reviews.Title: “The pits!”
Reviews.Author: flexifill
Reviews.Content: The worst of the worst! Never stayed in a place like this before, only upside was it provided my friends with loads of laughs when I meet them and told them how bad it was! Seeing is believeing! You have being warned!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value Good Location”
Reviews.Author: cannes16
Reviews.Content: In Life You Get what you pay for, and for 50 or 60 pounds it is the Cheapest Hotel in a good area in London, you wont find cheaper in the summer in london near the tube and bus station etc,yes it is run down and for a good reason as i am told a brand new hotel will be built on the site this year,hence it will be gone soon,I have found it is clean and staff are nice,I have paid alot more and got a lot worst in London Remember you get what you pay for in life !!!

Reviews.Title: “A fair and honest review”
Reviews.Author: Njal_Keay
Reviews.Content: The hotel room was small, there were cracks and stains on the walls, bedding, window and bathroom mirror. The cupboard door was hanging off its hinges. The fire door outside our room was held open by string attached to a fire extinguisher. We didn't stay for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “not great”
Reviews.Author: georgemcfly39
Reviews.Content: no tv lead in the room, the guy at reception , said the tv's are not working !!!! Though you could stick a hanger in it and it was fine, plus we could hear tv's from other rooms, room a bit rubbish, cheapm though think i paid £50 for a double, and close to where i wanted to go, but would not go back again!

Reviews.Title: “Awful-do not book!”
Reviews.Author: Clare1808
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for myself & my sister as we were going to a concert at the Apollo. I really should have read the reviews first. Although I only paid £70 for the night, that was still far to much for this after 'hotel'. Really had nothing going for it. Dirty, old, not comfortable, worst than a hotel. I booked this through Alpha rooms & I will be complaining to them. Didn't even bother with breakfast as looked awful. Couldn't bring ourselves to shower as looked disgusting. Lots of holes in the Walls which worried me. We literally stayed out as late as we could so we didn't have to sleep here too long. We got a few hours sleep then left very early in the morning & went elsewhere for breakfast! Apparently we had one of the best rooms (101) so sorry if you get one of the others as this was bad enough! Never ever will I stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Rubbish do not book”
Reviews.Author: Emma2103
Reviews.Content: Well on arrival wasnt sure it was actually classed as a HOTEL or B&B more of a hostel (but a bad one) On arrival receptionist complaining to company about other customers not great customer service. Room right next to reception (they must have had others available) and to be honest needed ALOT of updating. No character at all, the lounge actually just had a squeeky divan bed which was pointless. The main room had a matress which you could feel the bed slates through. Telly looked like was from the 1950's and no wardrobe other than a metal rack. The bathroom was tiny, old and dirty definatly in need of serious referb! Didnt even bother with breakfast due to everything else made us feel uncomfortable.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: CHRISP1980
Reviews.Content: What can i say,DO NOT STAY HERE! Does'nt quite cover it! This hotel is horrible. Stayed in room 217, basic is an understatement, holes in the wall where lights should of been, 1 tiny window so no ventalation made our stay very hot & uncomfortable. wardrobe doors hanging off, tv didnt work same problem with hair dryer. Didnt even attempt to eat what they called breakfast. Outside the hotel? looked like a bulding site. We payed £50 a nite for our 2 nite stay, What a rip off. DO NOT STAY AT THIS HOTEL YOU WILL BE VERY VERY DISAPOINTED!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible, waste of time and money”
Reviews.Author: Chinkasorus
Reviews.Content: I would tell every one I no to stay WELL CLEAR!!! Staff rude, shower was broken, no bath plug?!? So had to was in the sink!! Wall fixtures ripped of Walls, bathroom tiles smashed, no handles on windows, out of a ridiculous amount of light fittings only 2 with light bulbs in, floor boards ripped up so very easy to slice feet open, bed disgusting however sheets were clean, everything had an inch thick dust pile on it!! Tv broken and 'breakfast' was appalling, cerials but no bowls, no glasses for juice and toast that I waited 20 mins for!! Although may be cheap I'd rather have spent that extra money to go somewhere at least clean!! Even the exteria of the hotel was better left to the imagination!! An absolute disaster!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money! Fab location!”
Reviews.Author: catherine130388
Reviews.Content: Me and my grandma stayed here for one night in a twin room (201) we payed £18 each so £36 all together. And I was so pleased. So ok the starcase was a bit tatty and it dosnt look fab from the outside. But in my bedroom it was fine. Twin beds clean linen clean floor, plenty of space, mirrors and sockets. The bathroom needed updated urgently as was very old fashioned but it had a working toilet sink bath and shower n that's all u need! Fantastic value for money! Only negative was breakfast, rude waitress and extremely basic just cornflakes toast n grout. But what h pay is cheaper than most just room inked so u mat as well try ur! Very pleasant receptionist. Will go again as a base for our sightseeing! Good hotel

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: JOHNOSCOT
Reviews.Content: Please take note of these reviews! Really Really minging! We got a bargain haha! Never never again! Honestly felt like crying when we saw the room and the outside of the building! Holes in ceiling plug sockets hanging out of walls Hairdryer went red when i tried to use it! HAZARD! looks as if there had been a murder, in the hallway with all the marks on the walls! Breakfast very very poor! Cleanliness very poor in these premises! BE AWARE WHEN BOOKING!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Don't be misled - Read on!”
Reviews.Author: Lord_Williams
Reviews.Content: I stay at the Premier West Hotel monthly, have done so for the last year or two, and stayed there this week (1st Feb, 2011). Why? Because for London, it is very cheap, and for the proximity to Hammersmith tube station etc., it is absolutely ideal. I am pleased to see that some of the worst reviews about the hotel on this site are from further back in time, and it is gratifying to see an increase in the "not as bad as I thought" comments. I am a lone male traveller aged 53, and want a clean bed and a good night's sleep. That is what I get. Yes the place is run down and needs quite a bit of TLC, but if you want nice decor and plush fittings, then pay the extra and stay somewhere else. Don't stay here for around £40, expect the Ritz, and then whine about it. If you want a cheap price and a clean bed, then this is fine. Me? I will continue to stay here and have already booked for my March stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a gig ... Well, just great for a gig.”
Reviews.Author: Wellerfella
Reviews.Content: This is not the Ritz, more post blitz. However, for a gig at the Apollo it's ideal if you would rather not get a late train back or drive. It's really just for in and out type clients with a laid back sense of humour. Yes the windows wouldn't close properly, the kettle didn't work and the cleaners were arguing at 8am over who was the better flamenco dancer but who cares I had a bed and it was £45 band in the centre of Hammersmith and it's a 5min walk from the venue. I would stay again but only for gigs and price.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap - you get what you pay for!”
Reviews.Author: Lovelyrita2002
Reviews.Content: Well....locationwise this is excellent if you are going to a gig at the hammersmith Apollo and at £45 per night for a double room with breakfast you really can't argue with the price. However if luxury is your thing this is not the place for you! I've stayed at some average places but this must be the one with the longest list of things wrong. From windows that didn't close, a curtain that didn't fit the window to a cracked mirror in the bathroom and a broken kettle. However, the open window was counteracted by a brilliantly hot radiator so even if it was minus ten outside it was warm in the room! The noise however was pretty bad both inside and outside of the hotel throughout the night. Surprisingly after writing the above I would consider staying here again if I was attending another Apollo gig. My expectations are low so as long as you know what's potentially instore it's ok! Oh - we didn't bother with breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “NOT THAT BAD REALLY!”
Reviews.Author: Sjursaether
Reviews.Content: I stayed in room 214 for 5 nights. I didnt have a too bad negative experience with this hotel, even though I was really scared after reading comments on this page!!! The location of the hotel is awesome. Just 4 minutes walk to the Hammersmith tube. There was no smell in the lobby when I was there, there were a bit old smell in the hallways and stairs... but nothing to be dreaded about. The room was a bit small, but Im only one person and just going to sleep there. The bed was large and ok to sleep on. The thing I didnt like was that there was only a sheet to sleep with, and a blanket that I dont think was washed after each stay. There was also heating in the floor, which made the room very warm. And I had to have my window open, a bit uncomfy... But liveable. The bathroom was great. Large shower and clean. Didnt use the television, but it looked a bit cheap. There is nothing wrong with this hotel really... Its okay. dont be too scared by comments, atleast room 214 is fine.

Reviews.Title: “Aweful and unsafe. Recommand if your a student on the town but not familes!”
Reviews.Author: bunny2528
Reviews.Content: Myself and my partner stayed at this hotel for one night as it was quite close to earls court for topgear. I am disabled and a wheelchair user and stated this on the instructions when we got there there was no ramp just stairs access and when we eventually was abe to get inside the reception smelt terrible of rotten feet and there where blankets and washing all on the floor in the hall ways. we were placed in a room at the back of the office my wheel chair did not fit and was forced to use my crutches as i can only use them for short distances.. when we got in the room there was a bed that was so low to the floor that i struggled to get on, the blackets were single sheets for a double bed the tv was old and had a indoor ariel and we could not watch it there were exposed wires all out by the tv it was terrible. We asked for a nother blanket as the room was cold we were simply given a flat sheet and thats all.. the mattress was 3inches thick it was infact a mattress topper and not a proper mattress. sleeping was uncomfortable and noisy. the only desent thing about our room was the bathroom it looked lovely its a shame the rest of the room let it down. The breakfast area was ok and seemed clean enough but i did not enjoy the breakfast it was very stale. The other thing that i found to be in very bad practice was the payment method they claimed to not have a card machine and wrote my partners card details down on a form and said they wheregoing to get another sister hotel to do the transation. This worried me extremely as they took the security code from the back of the card also. We made them give us a photocopy of the form and if there is any unlawful action on his account we will be straight to the police. This hotel would prob be ok if you want to go out get lashed and come back sleep then go the next say but i would seriously not recommend it to anyone!!.

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE SMELLY AND DIRTY”
Reviews.Author: JayneyDidcot
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel without reading the reviews. we wished we had read them. The hotel was shabby in the reception area and it smelt really stale. We were directed to our room and it got worse by the second, the hallway was filthy and when we went into our room we were gobsmacked it was so shabby the shower was filthy and the smell was something else, but we were stuck there as we needed to go out and didnt have time to book anything else. The sheets were clean but that is all we had no blanket or quilt. The curtains didnt look like they had ever been washed and the carpet was minging. I wouldnt recommend this hotel, I know it is cheap but it would be worth paying more. we also tried to watch t.v. but it was a portable with an indoor ariel and the picture was awful. worse hotel we have ever stayed in

Reviews.Title: “Marginally better than sleeping in your car”
Reviews.Author: UkTravellerOnTour
Reviews.Content: Firstly on arrival they wrote down all of my card details, including the security number, onto a piece of paper. I really do not trust their security - these details could end up anywhere. I am changing my card. Pay by cash if you can. First impression: Faulty Towers. Booked last minute, so beggars cant be choosers. Glad I only stayed the one night. However, its well located for transport links and while the road outside had the potential to be noisy, at night it was tolerable even for my room which overlooked it. It was relatively cheap, but in retrospect it was false economy. I had a single room which was small and cramped. I have never slept in a worse bed which had so many lumps and divots. The room looked grubby, which made me check the bed frame for bed bugs (none found). The shower was cold water only - I adjusted all the controls and let it run for ages - no change. It was 7am, so not unreasonable to expect hot water. So I took a freezing shower - and the following day came down ill. Related? Perhaps. Breakfast starts at 7.30, so if you're up /out early then you're going hungry. I spent as little time here as possible. Stay somewhere else unless you are desperate, or really skint.

Reviews.Title: “filthy disgusting excuse for a hotel”
Reviews.Author: attilla71
Reviews.Content: stayed here for 8 nights really wish i had read the reviews. wat a joke booked a double room and got two single beds, asked for a double they gave us one but the mattress was stuffed had springs coming out off it and a massive sink hole on one side, so we decided to leave and get our money back. never ever stay at this hotel the cleaners are dirty and rude as all hell and dont even do there job we had no toilet paper for two days and had to ask for it 4 times and the hotel is smelly full off mould and literally falling apart.

Reviews.Title: “Yuk yuk yuk yuk yuk!!! Do NOT stay here!”
Reviews.Author: sambog
Reviews.Content: We would NOT recommend this hotel, I wish I had researched the area a bit to see that there was a Premier Inn across the street before booking! & thank god we booked online as it is usually £85 per night for a double room, we got it for £55. Upon arrival, the area looked pretty good, there were some lovely pubs & it's very close to Hammersmith tube station. The hotel itself looked run down and not at all welcoming. The staff were alright. When we were finding our room the stairways were narrow & badly lit. The room itself was tired & old, with paint peeling off the walls & broken floor tiles in the bathroom...and a big squashed fly above the bed and some strange splatter on the ceiling! An attempt had been made to make the room modern (pah!), with a new shower unit (this was the best bit), contemporary light fittings (not enough though! It was either stark light or off. Oh and it was terrible for applying make up), and a small flat screen tv to cover a big hole in the wall. The curtains were just awful, not hung properly but tied to the pole with string. The bed was really low, but comfy enough. One pillow each was provided. Towels were provided. The walls were thin, and we could hear the people above us walking around their room. There was a kitchenette in the room?! WHY!? It was just unnecessary, the money spent on that should have been used in other areas. Please do not waste your money on this hotel. I wasn't expecting it to be brilliant, we were in London on a budget - but I know from previous visits that there are far better hotels available for the same price. I will stick to a Premier Inn or Travel Lodge in future, at least you know what you're getting with them.

Reviews.Title: “Fine if you want a cheap hotel near the Apollo”
Reviews.Author: happyholidayer0
Reviews.Content: Reading the reviews on this hotel I think a lot of it is an exageration, this is a budget hotel, it reminded me of a travelers hotel in Europe but it is really really cheap!We paid £40 per night for two of us, at that price in the centre of London I dont think you can expect a luxury room!the whole place is very basic but I didnt see any mould or dirt, room was cleaned daily . We had tea and coffee making facilities and a microwave, fridge and kitchen sink but don't know if those are in ever room, certainly didnt expect them to be in ours! Bathroom was fine, bed was fine, location was excellent. The Apollo is 5 mins away, there is a little pub next door and a tube station 5 mins away. Hammersmith seemed nice and we went round a few pubs after the show which were all nice. This hotel turned out to be much better than expected , a great place to grab some sleep if your going to a show at the Apollo.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel from HELL ! Dirty,Smelly,Falling to bits DON'T DO IT”
Reviews.Author: Tom6016
Reviews.Content: When I booked this hotel I read the reviews on this site and came to the usumption that you get what you pay for and its a bed for the night, how bad can it be? The answer is BAD! Patches in the carpet, Mold in the bathroom, A disgusting smell coming from the bathroom possibly from the pipe that was gaffa taped over on the floor?, I turned the tap on and the top fell off! only two grainy channels on the TV, spray paint on the window(lucky really as there was a pile of rubbish including food waste just outside it) I could go on but I think you get the picture! Spend a bit more because you really don't want to spend a night of your life in this hotel (it pains me to call it that!) The only good thing about it was it's proximity to the apollo.

Reviews.Title: “An Extremely Poor Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Amelia_A_87
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at the Premier West Hotel we were shocked by the shabby state of the reception area, (eg. there were wires hanging from the walls in places) and you could tell it had been the victim of a very half-hearted and poor quality upgrading. There was also a very interesting smell through out the whole hotel! The man at reception was very unhelpful and seemed less than happy to be at work. We were informed that our reference number from our comfirmation email was not correct and he offered no other solution than that my partner should log onto his emails on the lobby computer in front of him and show him the email. I found this very suspicious and unnerving to say the least! We were not taken or directed to our room, but when we eventually found it we had difficulty using the key card to enter the room, especially as we had not been advised as to how they worked (neither of us had seen anything like them before!) The entire place was in desperate need of a redecorate. The room consisted of a broken curtain, a wardrobe with a broken door that was stablised by resting the entire base of the wardrobe on a bit of 2X4! The drains in the bathroom were blocked badly and stunk, shower covered in mould and a sink that wouldnt drain. The bed was clean except for two or three slightly suspicious hairs. It was however possibly the most uncomfortable bed we have ever slept in. The breakfast choice consisted of toast or cornflakes; apple or orange juice; tea or coffee. It really was basic and the lady 'serving' was really unhelpful, she made me feel very akward and as if we were simply an inconvience to her (we were left standing waiting for about five minutes before anyone invited us to just help ourselves). The next day we gave the breakfast a miss. I really can't explain just how poor this hotel is, the people working there clearly have no pride in their work. It was simply horrible.

Reviews.Title: “What is all the fuss about? This hotel is fab!!”
Reviews.Author: jos7569
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 1 night before the London Marathon, I had read all the dreadful reviews on here and was dreading staying at this hotel. But I was suprised!! The room was clean although we were in the basement and the corridor leading to it was stifling hot. I have stayed in worse hotels and paid a lot more money. For the price we found it to be a decent hotel and would stay there again. We did not have breakfast as it did not start till 8am and we left at 7am. If you are going to the London Appllo then this is the hotel for you it is less than 5 minutes walk away.

Reviews.Title: “Impolite receptionist”
Reviews.Author: aromart
Reviews.Content: On arrival the receptionist was very rude and unhelpful, There is parking provided but there is a £10.00 charge per day.there was no lift and no help was offered to carry bags up two flight of stairs, I found the card key difficult to use, In one of the rooms the sink was not draining properly.the overall cleanliness was very poor.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting!”
Reviews.Author: mel5050
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night to go to the apollo. The only good thing was its good location two min walk to apollo. Apart from this tho the bed sheets and toilet was clean (thank god) the room was falling apart, the door handle was a tea spoon and the running water was thick and grey coloured!! We had to but a big bottle of water from the shop to use to clean r teeth and wash r hands!!! No way were we havin a shower or breakfast!! Yuk. Do not stay here!!

Reviews.Title: “shocking- think i was secretly filmed!”
Reviews.Author: emily_darlington
Reviews.Content: This hotel was wierd....ended up staying in the staff room as they had overbooked. They only charged me my booking fee, however I would stay again even if they offered me money. Smelly, dangerous and creepy are the words I would use to describe this and that is an understatement. Even had my things tampered with when I went out for a walk. Cheap and a good location but other than that, please never stay here....

Reviews.Title: “awful”
Reviews.Author: councillorWB
Reviews.Content: Very dirty place I'm afraid. It was however very cheap, and they say that you get what you pay for, but I still expect cleanliness. There are very words to describe how bad this place is. Reception was extremely hot, very stuffy with a strange smell. Check in was ok and the guy on the front desk was helpful enough. Walking up the stairs to the room was very dirty - carpets, walls etc. The room itself was very unsafe as the door to the room did not actually fit the hole. I suspect it isn't even the original door to the room. The lock was also very loose in the door. The room had loose floor boards, the bed sheets were limited and the bathroom was unclean with the shower head thick with limescale. The bedroom window overlloked the hotel back yard, which included old matresses that had obviously been there for months, if not years. Very, very dissapointed.

Reviews.Title: “A Decent B&B Hotel... For those on Tight Budget”
Reviews.Author: indisuresh
Reviews.Content: A Decent B & B (Bed & Breakfast) Hotel for those who are on a tight budget to London. Plus: Very Close to the Hammersmith Tube Station and Bus Station which connects you to the London very well Close to the Main market Area of Hammersmith with a Decent shopping Arcades / Malls few blocks away. Good Healthy Fixed Menu Breakfast. Free Wi-Fi Internet Access at the Reception Area. The Hotel is managed by Indians and hence will be a advantage to travelling Indian The rates are cheap. Minuses: The Hotel is bit old and has a distinct smell. The rooms are small and had some problems in the bathroom. Overall experiance can be said as just OK. If you are on a tight budget I did recommend

Reviews.Title: “Good for what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: matthew0207
Reviews.Content: I booked to stay in this hotel for five nights, i found the hotel very easy its only about 3 mins walk from Hammersmith station. i paid £35 a night and thought that was very reasionable for a hotel in the location that it was it. The room was small but was enough room just for me, there was a light coming away from the wall in the bedroom but that didnt bother me. The room was very clean and so was the bathroom. The problem i had with the bathroom was that they only seemed to be hot water first thing on a morning and if i wanted a shower on a evening it was cold, that was the only major problem i could find with this hotel. The maid came in every morning and cleaned the room and left fresh towels, the guys on reception were always very frendly when i spoke to them. My room was lovely and warm as the heating was on all the time. I think you get what you pay for, i really didnt mind the room and would stay there again. i was on the 2nd floor in room 220

Reviews.Title: “PLEASE DO NOT STAY HERE”
Reviews.Author: RKClark
Reviews.Content: Worst hotel ever: Firstly we booked through an agent we requested a cot for our 7 1/2 month old daughter, when we arrived they advised they don't have cots but they 'upgraded' a term I use loosly to a family room with a single bed of couse my baby could not sleep in this bed so I had to share the double bed with her and my husband had to sleep in the single. There was a dirty towel on the floor of the bathroom when we arrived we thought that it was left behind by the cleaner but it was there to mop up the leaking toilet yuck. The reception stank of mould, there were no plugs for sink or bath the shower ran I could continue on but judt ask you pay extra and stay somewhere nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as I feared”
Reviews.Author: Student_Traveller09
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews on this site I was very worried about staying in the Premier West. I was relieved to find that although the room I was staying in was cheaply furnished it was at least clean. The room was small but I was hardly expecting a large room at a budget hotel in central London. The shower, TV, central heating and hairdryer all worked properly in contrast with other people's experiences here. The staff at reception were reasonably friendly and the hotel is excellently located for Hammersmith tube station and travelling into the city. This hotel is probably best for short stop-overs as the quality of the rooms is not high enough for a stay of more than a few days. The Premier West is excellent value for money for its handy location and we paid for our room at a special offer price of £40 (I'd don't think I'd pay any more to stay there)

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Disgusting!!! Avoid like the Plague!!!”
Reviews.Author: l6z9a
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from my one nights stay at the PREMIER West Hotel!!!! I am so angry that I feel as though I have to write this review now just to get it off my chest!!!! This hotel is vile - Outside is awful, steps leading to the reception are unsafe, tiles falling off. We were checked in by a unfriendly chap who could not speak a word of English!!!! When we eventually found our room (down in the basement) I was not impressed..... It was damp, cold, bare (plenty of words to describe it none of them good)!!! No light in the basement corridor, so found it difficult to see. As the room was so cold, I noticed a fan heater outside the room in the corrider, so I took this for our room!!! Not a lot of bedding on the bed, just one sheet, no duvet, no blankets.... the TV did not work, no picture... Had a kettle but no cups.... Shower rail fell off the wall and cockroaches came out through the holes where it had come off!!! Damp stains on walls... Thunderstorms in the night left 4 inches of water in the basement outside of our window with litter floating round!!! Wooden floor in the bedrooms above meant I was not able to sleep at all through the night as people in that room were constantly walking round!!! Went to reception to tell them (no one to be found).... Didnt have Breakfast as didnt really want to be ill, so walked a couple of minutes up the road and had breakfast at McDonalds!!!! Unfortunately I was meeting my boyfriend who is away working so was unsure where he was booked in to stay so could not check out the reviews as I usually do... If I had seen the reviews, I would never of stayed here!!! I know people reading this may think -it cant be that bad, Please believe what you read here, its all true.... & I cant see it getting better!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “i didn't like the idea of sharing my breakfast with the gents toliets”
Reviews.Author: filey3
Reviews.Content: he room inwhich we stayed was not clean. i didn't like the idea of sharing my breakfast with the gents toliets. talking about the breakfast ,well what breakfast (one slice of toast or cornflake which everybody had a hand in). no disable access to higher floors, so if you were a disabled person tough!!! as for thier website pictures do not believe everything you see. s.brown & family, filey, north yorkshire.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing 'Premier' about this place - the worst hotel I have *ever* stayed in.”
Reviews.Author: StageDiver
Reviews.Content: Like several other reviewers, I walked past this hotel the first time I passed it as I could not believe this was the place. Nothing like shown on website. Found myself looking for an hourly tariff on entry. Quite, quite horrible. Good things (the short list): - Location excellent for where we were working during the week. - The pub over the road ("Dartmouth Castle") has good beer and outside sitting area. Bad things (quite extensive): - Dirty, run down all round. - Room awful; dirty, smelly, peeling paint, broken furniture, no smoke alarm. - Television that got one channel, thick with dust. Aerial hanging off curtain hook on wall. - Dirty, loose toilet seat, grey towels, mouldy shower, mouldy ceiling. I am convinced this hotel is a hazard to travellers too - no smoke alarm in room, fire-doors propped open with fire-extinguishers etc. I would not even give 1 star for the cleanliness, rooms or value. Have taken photographs for when we review our visit to London next week, and will be asking questions about who booked us into this hole - this really was a risk to my and my colleagues health.

Reviews.Title: “Re-live London's Dark Ages at Premier West!”
Reviews.Author: Baldrick007
Reviews.Content: Nostalgia fans will love this authentic 16th Century traveller's hovel, gloriously exemplifying low-life London as it's meant to be lived. Wonder at the marvel of minimalist cleaning techniques, extol the virtues of land-fill-reclaimed furniture and make new friends with the resident insect life. Reject the temptations of pavement living by spending one night living life as it used to be lived and book into Premier West today - you'll be sure you're making the right choice of returning to the park bench for the next night. Believe the mantra "Life's about making the right decisions".

Reviews.Title: “About average for budget London Hotel”
Reviews.Author: gmagpie26
Reviews.Content: I bookd through Late Rooms and got an excellent value £17.50 a night, which included breakfast - cereal, toast and juice. Great location - Hammersmith tube just a few minutes walk. There is free wifi in the lobby - don't bother trying to pay for the wifi in the room, because you'll never connect, the signal is terrible most of the time. The tv also had limited reception, sometimes great, sometimes crappy. After reading the reviews, I had reservations about staying but decided that as I've stayed in plenty of crappy English hotels... and the Premier West is an example of that. The lobby is shabby but the receptionists are very friendly. The ground floor corridor fire-door is helped to shut by a piece of folded paper - and this is where the Premier West Hotel comes into its own... My single room (109) looked ok - wooden flooring, private bathroom, the radiator worked and the window opened but despite it being newly-ish refurbished, you can tell in a few months it'll be a crappy room again because everything that should be fixed into position is starting to fall off already (toilet roll holder, toilet flush, bathroom floor tiles). The towels were changed every day. The bed linen was clean but the counterpane was splotched with what I hope were tea stains - this is because the bedside table is at the end of the bed with a small tv and kettle perched on top of it - no easy way to make tea without spilling it! They only refreshed the tea/coffee every other day but the kettle did work! For me, comfy enough for £17.50 a night. I'd feel quite ticked off if I'd paid more though because there are too many little irritations to make your stay comfortable enough, unless it's just for one night.

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs in Premier West!!”
Reviews.Author: gal5
Reviews.Content: Stay away!! BedBugs all over the place. Bed bugs are potential Hepatis B + C transmitter. Terrible Place. If there is any way of closing this House, just do it, please

Reviews.Title: “Stay away!”
Reviews.Author: Shocked19
Reviews.Content: Absolutely terrible experience. The worst place I've ever seen. Mould on a carpet, no doors on any of the closets, sheets looked like they never been washed and had holes in them. There are no words to discribe toilet. We came to the hotel, saw how it was and left straight to another hotel. Seen many hotels around the world but nothing like this. Don't go there!

Reviews.Title: “The worst Hotel ever- Be Warned”
Reviews.Author: Johnleomcl
Reviews.Content: I was so disgusted with this hotel that I immediately checked any sites where you can give reviews to warn any other potential customers. This is absolutely the worst hotel I have ever stayed in. I suggest any hotel room booking agencies check this place about before placing potential customers. I inspect and rate Hotels in my professional job and was booked in another hotel which fell through last minute. As I was working in Hammersmith this hotel was the only one available for the date I requested. I really don't know where to start on this place. Soiled towels, bathroom ceiling peeling, shower dripping all night, bucket under toilet to catch water dripping from pipe, hole in the roof stuffed with paper, soiled carpets, TV which would fail any PAT test for being dangerous, no picture and aerial lying on floor, holes in bed sheets, blanket that you wouldn’t give your dog to sleep on, filthy stained carpets, dust on every surface, till receipt under bed from 8 months previous which shows it has never been vacuumed, wardrobe door hanging off, and to top it all a phone which didn't work when I was expecting a emergency call to see how my mother was in hospital. apparently the receptionist tried to call room 3 times ? Worse still was the fact I booked this through hotelclub where I get a discount of £40 and I still paid £75 for this absolute dump. I will make it my business to do everything in my power to have this place shut down whether it be through Hammersmith council, Health and safety office or environmental health. Be Warned, this place should be condemned.

Reviews.Title: “Worst place ever”
Reviews.Author: variabel
Reviews.Content: This was the worst hotel I've ever stayed at, smelled extremely bad of dust and dirt in the hallways, which had spread to the rooms, so we had to sleep with open windows the first night, resulting in trouble sleeping from the chill from outside and the traffic and sirens. The room was extremely small with not a single thing working, the shower was broken, everything was run down and broken. The wardrobe fell over if you opened the doors. Poor cleaning of the room, and because of the bugs we had to check our bed so we wouldn't sleep with thermites. The water damaged bathroom had an appauling smell and the bed was not nice to sleep in. Also, the room couldn't have been smaller. The dining room was hideous with a minimal breakfast served by rude personel who barely spoke english. Nothing was good with this hotel, it is SO good to go away from it. I would recommend anyone to stay away from the Premier West, the price is way too high for that dump. The feeling afterwards is as though we were being ripped off. Do not book this hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, will use again”
Reviews.Author: Scartboy
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a weekend. The room was small as the on-suite shower-room/WC had been built into one side of it, but both were clean. The room was on the front of hotel and there was quite a lot of traffic noise, quieter at the weekend, but tempo picked up on Monday morning. Well located, close to tube, buses and shops. Reception area and breakfast room area were OK, hallways and stairs were shabby. The reception staff were friendly and helpful. Felt it was good value for money, considering some of the dumps I've stayed in in the same price class in London .

Reviews.Title: “THE PITS”
Reviews.Author: cherokeeManchester
Reviews.Content: myself and my little boy booked for one night at this hotel.. on arriving i could see the hotel was in disrepair. however when we reached the room i was in shock.. i pulled back the beddin to find a very old bobbly blanket. the sheet on the mattress had holes in it showing the disgusting mattress. i decided there and then we wouldn be sleeping in the bed. i tried to calm down and make a cuppa. on opening the lid of the kettle i saw the furriest limescale i have ever seen. therefore i was not using it ,so no drink facilities.. due to my itching i decided to shower but on taking the towels off the rail i found all four of them filthy. they had mascara like marks on them and various other unidentifiable stains. i took these to the reception to request clean towels but the man could not see my problem he therefore gave me 2 floor mats to use as towels. after lying awake all night fully clothed on top of the bed we could not wait for morning to have breakfast and leave. the 'continental' breakfast consisted of a packet of ceral and toast. the cutlery was filthy, the cups chipped. i swooped my little boy up and we left at 7.30am. our coach home was not till 4pm and we wandered around London for several hours.. Unfortunately i had nowhere else to go and no money to book somewhere else to stay. my alternative would have been to sleep rough.. had i not had my son with me i would seriously considered that.. the reason i booked this hotel was that i believed it to be part of the premier hotel group..

Reviews.Title: “I thought it wasn't bad ... !”
Reviews.Author: isawthelight
Reviews.Content: Altough Prince Charles may not stay in this hotel in the near future, it isn't half as bad as described on this page. I guess it is a matter of what you expect. Rooms are small and a bit used, but the bed and the bathroom were really clean and I had no trouble sleeping. I did look for Manuel, the Spanish waiter, though. But I guess it was his day off.

Reviews.Title: “Don't let the bed bugs bite at the Premier West!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: tallaght24dublin
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in this hotel at the start of August. On arrival at the hotel I was disappointed to find it was very run down and dilapitated. I could not understand how it claimed a three star rating maybe its closeness to the station. We always stay in three star hotels as we use the hotel as a base an do a lot of touring etc when we go away but we have never had an experience like this before. There was a strange smell in the foyer . There was wallpaper falling off the walls in the stairwell and the banister was secured by sticky tape in parts. Our room was supposed to be double but it was twin so we pushed the beds together to find one mattress higher than the other the lower one seemed very old and worn.Our room had everything they said it would have when we booked, however they forgot to add bed bugs to the list!!! I noticed strange marks on the bed linen but did not know what they were. I noticed something crawling across my chest on the last night around 3.30 am and i hopped out of bed, turned the light on and found these bugs crawling all over me. I immediately showered and washed my hair in freezing water. I could not go back to sleep and complained at breakfast time to reception. ( the continental is just two cereal, tea, juice and toast) The man at reception did seem sympathetic and said he would complain to housekeeping. On our return home we found we both had a rash all over us, my husbands was much worse than mine. We went to the doctor and he confirmed with the help of the photos i took of them that they were indeed BED BUGS!!!! we had been bitten and our rash was an allergic reaction which we had for a week. We ended up spending a fortune on creams and tablets, sprays and disinfectants. The premier west hotel was not reasonable to us because of the further expense it caused our health. I have made a complaint to the local council and they are investigating. If you value your health DO NOT STAY IN THIS HOTEL.

Reviews.Title: “Reminded me of faulty towers only worse”
Reviews.Author: kellye4
Reviews.Content: Staff where nice, but the hotel its self was awful needs a great deal of repairs. Our room had drawers missing, holes in the walls and bad carpet, I refused to stay and was still made to pay for the first night so be warned!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Never again!”
Reviews.Author: CAM74
Reviews.Content: I could tolerate the ragged appearance as we approached this 'hotel' (weeds everywhere, unmaintained paintwork, filthy windows, broken canopy on the floor etc) but had to draw the line at what came inside. Although the staff were polite, this place felt more like a seedy motel. I appreciate it is cheap for the excellent location but cannot see how the stench walking down to the basement rooms can be forgiven. The walls at the bay window here were covered with huge black patches of damp and thin curtains loosely held to the rail in 2 places! A stack of rubbish immediatley outside the window has to be attractive to rats and an obvious health hazzard. This place had a general era of a distinct lack of care and hygiene. Needless to say I did not feel comfortable enough to eat or drink in this place and would never return, irrespective of the price! What a horrible experience!

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel I ever stayed”
Reviews.Author: Imti1a
Reviews.Content: The room was terribly small and there was a reading lamp fixed over the bed which burnt my hand while coming out from the toilet, and left a mark forever not to forget this hotel!!:) There was no lift so I had to go to the upper floor pulling all my bags on the stairs!! It seemed that the owner of the hotel didn’t want to show their hotel name clearly on the name board outside so they had given ‘PW’ or something instead of the full name, which kept us searching for the hotel for sometime! The breakfast was okay and the free internet in the lobby was also a good thing!

Reviews.Title: “Welcome to Faulty Towers Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DaveNL
Reviews.Content: This is a hotel, or so they say... We arrived at a building in dire need of painting and refurbishing. The price is cheap, especially for the neighborhood, but don't get any idea's. The rooms are small, the beds are acceptable in some rooms but my colleague had broken beds (room 221). One bed had a mattress with a 20 cm depression in the middle. The other fell apart completely. Hot water takes a while (you can read a book). The TV works but the reception is only acceptable on one channel (BBC1). The rooms have a hairdryer and a water heater, a tv, 2 beds, a desk, a trouser press, a bathroom with shower, sink and toilet. After complaining about the beds, my colleague changed to room 107 which is a bit bigger, a bit better and has a small kitchen. My own room (219) was acceptable for the price. In short: if you are looking for a hotel that looks like a hotel and are prepared to pay a bit more: look elsewhere. If you want to save some cash, you could consider this hotel. Just don't say we didn't warn you...

Reviews.Title: “Will book it again”
Reviews.Author: moit
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews on the site I was scared of booking this hotel. However, I was pleasantly surprised. The hotel exterior does need a paint, but the room and the lobby seems to be all right. The room was decent, there was breakfast in the morning, reception was friendly and there was wireless internet in the lobby. They helped us with directions and other local information. I have stayed in a lot of 50£ a night hotels and this one qualifies for the better ones. Its not a Dorchester but 50£ only gets you as much or worse in Central London.

Reviews.Title: “oh good god!”
Reviews.Author: trickynic
Reviews.Content: THE worst hotel I have ever stayed in, and I've stayed at many budget hotels. The hotel is really run down, and although the reception staff seemed friendly enough, they had no local knowledge which resulted in them sending us on a wild goose chase when we phoned for directions during rush hour traffic! We booked a double room but settled for a twin as there was no doubles available. The room was a decent size but had a very musty smell and there was an extra broken bed in the corner of the room. The bathroom had paint peeling off the ceiling and holes stuffed with tissue paper. The toilet only flushed every few hours and the taps spluttered water all over you. The best was yet to come - we went out for the night and returned in the early hours. We then discovered there were no duvets on the beds (even though it was winter), just white sheets (which were clean) and a manky blanket on one bed but not the other. My bed creaked really loudly at every turn but was comfy enough. My husband's bed however COLLAPSED as soon as he got into it!!! It was late at night and so rather than report it and have to pack up our things, my husband opted to sleep on the mattress on the floor. We complained in the morning but didn't even get an apology. We tried to get some of our money back but they weren't having any of it. It didn't bode well that when we first apologised to reception, he just took out a piece of paper with "Problems" written at the top and just added it to the list. On a positive note, the hotel is in a very convenient location and it is cheap, but it's cheap for a reason!

Reviews.Title: “Frightening and grotty”
Reviews.Author: CliveSouth
Reviews.Content: They say don't make the same mistake twice. Our first visit here was back in 2000 for a night. the bedding was covered in glitter and the whole place was cold and shabby. One night this month we needed desperately to sleep after a show. It was a bargain option pricewise but we just wanted to sleep. Again the bedding was stained, the radiators freezing, and the whole place was like a dodgy hostel. The hotel has a scary atmosphoere which feels unsafe and decayed. We hope that this review will stop others considering this budget option. Even if they paid their guests, the experience is unpleasant and unsavoury

HotelInfo.Name: Premier West Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 28 - 34 Glenthorne Rd, London W6 0LS, England
